channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James has two days to turn around a £100,000 loan on a sapphire and diamond ring, while a former fashionista approaches Claudia about her designer handbag collection. A yoga devotee wants a loan on items from her past so she can invest in the future, and James has to make a snap decision on an Italian classic scooter.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve try to find a buyer for financial adviser Ray and his girlfriend Eve, while Casas Manuel is helping Brian and Esther from Glasgow to find a home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil visits Stamford, Lincolnshire, where Mark and Tina Harrison's three-bedroom home needs a revamp to help it appeal to younger buyers. He also discovers a house that is being pitched at the family market with no success. It has the right size, a decent garden and a good location, but with stains on almost every carpet, the owners need to put a lot of work into it. Can the expert turn both properties around in just one week?.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a married couple who cannot decide whether to buy a property in Provence or Keswick. While Enid has been dreaming of life in the south of France for as long as she can remember, Dennis is more interested in the scenery of the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lee and fiancee Nicky begin the competition in Bristol with an Italian-themed menu, followed by Libby and Graham, who have been married for 54 years, and lively couple Nico and Sky.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jade and Stuart kick off the competition from Essex with a fun and spontaneous menu, entertaining rivals Mark and Diane, and Chris and Rosella.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary about surveillance on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. In the wake of the abdication, the couple took a holiday in America, unaware they were being spied on by US intelligence agencies as well as British. The outbreak of the Second World War saw them move on to Lisbon, where their dealings with a known Nazi collaborator raised concerns for MI5.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow the drama at Liverpool Women's Hospital, where Jodie, 19, found out that she was pregnant after she had a fling with Stephen, 22. He's determined to see his parental responsibilities through, including being at her bedside during a long labour. Also featured is 44-year-old Derroll, who met his wife Maria online. She's a mother of four and wants him to experience fatherhood for himself, but it's not without its challenges.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues her pursuit of the world's wealthiest people, meeting a man who got rich from caravan parks, a motivational speaker who made money helping others, and a man who can gold plate anything to order.(n)

programme.title: Homeland
programme.desc: Keane and Saul join forces to shut down the campaign of disinformation, things come to a head for Carrie and Quinn, and Max is detained by Dar.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Platt, the President and CEO of entertainment and fitness business Sky Zone, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win an action-adventure holiday. He aims to discover whether his fast-growing company is running as smoothly and efficiently as possible, but his secret identity is jeopardised when he encounters a colleague he has met on a previous occasion.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou and the team receive a visit from a former Chelsea footballer who has brought along some expensive watches. James is also put to the test when asked to evaluate a hovercraft from a Bond film, and an unusual painting of Saddam Hussein causes a stir in the office. Also, there's a big surprise for a mother looking to sell some spectacular jewellery to help her son's business venture.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Warrington, where he meets Pauline and Alan Jacks, who have been trying to sell their three-bedroom property. He soon realises potential buyers may have been deterred by the dated decor, cuddly toys, tapestries and dolls dotted around the place. A few miles away, Colin Brunold has been hoping his four-bedroom family home would sell itself, but a dodgy chimney could be putting off house-hunters.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Businesswoman Karen would like to invest in a property and has a flexible budget of £280,000. Karen is torn: her heart is pulling her towards a new life abroad, but her adult daughter Danielle wishes her to remain in Britain. While Jasmine Harman finds her some tempting offers in Chamonix in the French Alps, Jonnie Irwin shows her the trendy east side of London.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, married couple Karen and Nigel kick off the competition with a Bajan-themed menu, followed by Beth and Clem's meal, and Jo and Charlie's Greek night.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Sheffield, with Ray and Chloe, Andrew and Claire, and Rob and Emma all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants that he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have their owners pulled themselves out of their nightmares?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south-west London to help another two couples find their dream home. Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Warship
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the Royal Navy's HMS Ocean on a seven-month active deployment, policing some of the most volatile waters on the planet and co-ordinating the fight against Isis. In this first edition, HMS Ocean leaves Plymouth for the Mediterranean, where the Tailored Air Group of elite armed forces helicopter pilots have just three weeks to learn how to take off and land on a carrier, but engine problems and the approach of a huge storm mean the new recruits and the old hands must pull together to succeed.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues her pursuit of the world's wealthiest people, meeting a man who got rich from caravan parks, a motivational speaker who made money helping others, and a man who can gold plate anything to order.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules

Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Long, Hayden Panettiere and Dennis Hopper.(n)

Stewart McCracken and Elmor Victor face a heartbreaking house repossession in Merseyside, where two landlords are forced to evict a tenant recovering from a brain tumour which has cost him his job and income.(n)

programme.title: Shannon Matthews: The Mother's Story
programme.desc: The disappearance of nine-year-old Shannon Matthews in 2008 gripped the nation. Her mother Karen claimed that her daughter had gone missing on her way home from school, prompting a nationwide search. But weeks later, it was revealed that Karen had known the truth all along - Shannon was being kept hidden by a man known to her mother, who had plotted to claim the £50,000 reward money for her return. This documentary tries to get at the truth of a woman many have branded as evil, asking what drove her to do it, how she can rebuild her life and whether she is sorry for her actions.(n)

programme.title: Sex Tape
programme.desc: A married couple decide to put some passion back into their dull marriage by filming themselves having sex. However, a technological mix-up results in the footage being uploaded to various gadgets, and they race against time to recover all the copies before it ends up in the public eye. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz and Jason Segel.(n)

Scott and Leanne from Liverpool order some bouncy castles as they start a party business, while single mum Rachel treats her family and friends to an all-you-can-eat Chinese buffet.(n)

programme.title: Jackie Chan's The Forbidden Kingdom
programme.desc: An American teenager obsessed with kung fu movies is sent back in time to ancient China, where he joins the battle to free the imprisoned Monkey King. The only problem is he has no martial arts skills of his own, and will need the assistance of two legendary warriors to become the hero he needs to be. Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Cheech and Chong's Next Movie
programme.desc: Richard Marin and Thomas Chong's misadventures as bumbling musicians(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson team up for this comedic spy flick, which is an energetic updating of the 1960s TV series of the same name. Bumbling secret agent Alex Scott (Wilson) forms an alliance with cocky boxing champion Kelly Robinson (Murphy) to vanquish an evil underground arms dealer (Malcolm McDowell), who has pilfered a top-secret stealth fighter jet(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Household servant Willard, sick of the meanness of his millionairess employer, snaffles her hound Muffin but botches the job so hopelessly that everyone thinks that he's been kidnapped(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A musician works with mobsters to advance his career but falls in love with the girlfriend of a gangland kingpin(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Jill Sprecher's film follows five New Yorkers whose lives intertwine, from eternal optimist Alan Arkin to his pessimistic colleague John Turturro, with Matthew McConaughey as a hot-shot lawyer whose life is derailed by a road accident(n)

programme.title: Quick Change
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in this comedy about three thieves who find robbing a New York City bank easy, but escaping the city to be almost impossible!(n)

programme.title: Just Cause
programme.desc: A legal expert whose days of trying cases are long behind him, Harvard Law School professor Paul Armstrong is moved by a plea he receives from a Florida death row inmate, Bobby Earl. It seems that the educated, upstanding Earl has been railroaded by an overeager sheriff zealously trying to solve the kidnapping and murder of a little girl(n)

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke stars as a former professional-wrestling superstar fallen on hard times and grappling with a rocky personal life while looking for a chance at a comeback in the ring(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retired successful business owner and widower (Robert De Niro) lands an internship at a fashion website run by a young, career-driven woman (Anne Hathaway) in this Warner Bros. comedy from writer/director Nancy Meyers (The Holiday, It's Complicated)(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: An uptight college dean is determined to have his most unruly frat house expelled, enlisting the help of the most respectable house on campus(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing his faith in Christmas and tearing apart his letter to Santa, a young boy (Emjay Anthony) accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus. The following day, his family awaken to find that a massive blizzard has knocked out the power in their house, and they are soon forced to fight for survival as the fearsome folklore creature and his minions proceed to wreak havoc on the dysfunctional clan. Adam Scott, Toni Collette, and David Koechner co-star in this hybrid of black comedy and horror from director Michael Dougherty (Trick 'r Treat)(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A young journalist must investigate a mysterious videotape which seems to cause the death of anyone in a week of viewing it(n)

programme.title: Godsend

programme.desc: Bridesmaids Revisited. The air is thick enough to cut with a knife in the offices of the Yale Daily News; though Rory (Alexis Bledel) is now editor, her predecessor Paris (Liza Weil) is still on the staff, and still seething with resentment. Nor is this Rory's only cross to bear: while attending the wedding of Logan's sister Honor (Devon Sorvari), Rory learns from each one of the bridesmaids that Logan (Matt Czuchry) was far from lonely -- or celibate -- during their brief separation. Back in Stars Hollow, Lorelai (Lauren Graham) babysits for Christopher's three-year-old daughter, Gigi (Nicolette Collier), who turns out to be a thoroughly out-of-control brat; and Zach (Todd Lowe) tries to reunite the band even as Lane (Keiko Agena) advertises for new members(n)

programme.desc: Well-meaning but witless ex-con 'H' McDunnough causes pandemonium when he steals one of Arizona's famous newborn quintuplets for his infertile wife. Comedy(n)

programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a helicopter pilot races to rescue his daughter and estranged wife as a series of massive earthquakes devastate California. Meanwhile, a Cal Tech professor attempts to warn other citizens(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalize Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a sleazy book dealer endeavouring to locate a rare occult work. The dealer is hired by a wealthy bibliophile to locate the two remaining copies of a 17th-century book entitled The Nine Gates to the Kingdom of Shadows. As he travels from New York to Madrid and Paris, he learns that the book is rumoured to have been written by the Devil - and to contain the key to conjuring him up(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: Set in the early 1970s, this biopic stars Denzel Washington as real-life New York City drug kingpin Frank Lucas, and Russell Crowe as the cop sworn to bring him down(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Based on a true event, the film follows the 2010 mining disaster incident where a group of thirty-three miners were trapped inside the San Jose mine in Chile for more than two months after a gold and copper mine collapses(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: A radio DJ stationed in a US base in Vietnam infuriates the brass with his own anarchic brand of humour(n)

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Patrick Swayze stars as a tough bouncer who is hired by the owner of shabby roadhouse bar to clean up its act(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Canadian safecracker Nick Wells has lost the taste for crime, but one final offer from his old fence Max lures him back into the game. Only this time he's working with a young hotshot who has his own plans for the theft of a priceless sceptre(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: In this raunchy satire based on the hit HBO series, young Hollywood A-lister Vincent Chase (Adrian Grenier) and his posse of best buds (Kevin Connolly, Jerry Ferrara and Kevin Dillon) negotiate the perils and pleasures of Hollywood life, with the help of superagent Ari Gold (Jeremy Piven)(n)

programme.title: Bird on a Wire
programme.desc: After years on the FBI Witness Protection Program, Rick Jarmin finds his life threatened by a murderous gang of drug dealers. When he drags his ex-girlfriend into the deadly milieu, the pair set off on a crazy cross-country adventure(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Gripping, all-action sci-fi thriller about a cyborg who is sent back from the future, where machines rule the earth, to kill an apparently innocent woman who in fact holds the key to the survival of the human race. A lone protector is sent to save her - but which one will reach her first? Schwarzenegger is perfectly cast as the seemingly unstoppable cyborg and, true to his line 'I'll be back', returned in a 1991 sequel(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In the future, criminals are arrested before they have even committed their crime, thanks to the forecasting of 'pre-cogs'. Detective John Anderton thinks the system is perfect... until he's arrested. Brilliant sci-fi thriller based on a story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.desc: Hitler's Dangerous Car Journeys. Hitler endangers himself following campaigns in Poland and France(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: A New Germany (1933-1939). Laurence Olivier narrates the acclaimed documentary series. Stricken by the humiliation of defeat, Germany looks to Adolf Hitler for a resurgence of hope(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Distant War (September 1939 - May 1940). Chronicling the events that followed Britain's declaration of war against Germany. Highlights include the Russian invasion of Finland, the mining of Norwegian waters by Britain and France and Germany's control of Norway's airfields. Also, the resignation of Prime Minister Chamberlain after the Norwegian defeat(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: France Falls (May - June 1940). Spring 1940: France falls under German attack. On film: the Maginot line, where the French wait while German Panzer divisions advance through the unprotected Ardennes forest. Parachutists invade neutral Holland, Rommel defeats the French at Sedan and the German war machine moves on to Paris. At Dunkirk, Allied troops are evacuated. Belgium capitulates. The Franco-German Armistice is signed at Compiegne. Laurence Olivier is the host(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). May 1940: troops are evacuated from Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain begins. Churchill makes his famous "finest hour" speech and Britain prepares. Newsreel films show dogfights over Dover, the bombing of London, rescue work and royal tours of blitzed areas. The House of Commons is hit and Germany invades the USSR. Narrator: Laurence Olivier(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Barbarossa (June - December 1941). Acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II, narrated by Laurence Olivier. The pact between Germany and the Soviet Union outwears its usefulness, and Hitler turns his tanks and troops against Russia. After a succession of devastating victories, the Germans delay fatally, and the fierce Russian winter takes a grip(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Banzai!: Japan (1931-1942). December 7, 1941 brings the infamous attack on Pearl Harbor(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). May 1940: troops are evacuated from Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain begins. Churchill makes his famous "finest hour" speech and Britain prepares. Newsreel films show dogfights over Dover, the bombing of London, rescue work and royal tours of blitzed areas. The House of Commons is hit and Germany invades the USSR. Narrator: Laurence Olivier(n)

programme.desc: The imitation sunglasses that could seriously harm your health and the counterfeit brake pads that could cost lives. Presented by Matt Allwright.(n)

A book and a terracotta vase are among the objects catching the antiques experts' eyes, while presenter Paul Martin walks along Southend Pier.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. programme.desc: Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright exposes the trade in fire blankets the manufacturers have made fraudulent safety claims about, as well as reporting on fake tattoo inks that could be lethal and counterfeit operations being run in spare rooms and garages around the UK.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Carmel attempts to build bridges with Stacey, but she is less than forgiving and refuses to let her see Arthur - so Max intervenes on Carmel's behalf. Steven is unimpressed when Lauren arranges another girls' night out, Michelle confides in Sharon after an awkward shift at the cafe with Bex, and Ben and Jay enjoy the company of their temporary guests.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: It's John's grandmother's birthday, but he has completely forgotten to post her card. Will he be able to put things right on the journey to work? Comedy about the daily commute of supermarket employees John Redmond and Kayleigh Kitson, who have been thrown together in a company car share scheme, with each trip bringing fresh insight into their lives, as well as twists and turns in their unlikely relationship. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson, with Danny Swarsbrick.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: With a lot preying on her mind, the last thing Kayleigh needs is to find herself given the task of promoting national blackcurrant jam week. Fortunately, her car-sharing colleague John is on hand to encourage her with plenty of unwanted advice. Wry comedy, co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Actor-turned-documentarian Ross Kemp joins Agnes in her studio lounge, where his survival skills are put to the test. Chef Aly whips up another culinary storm as comedian Kevin Bridges - and his mother Patricia - join him in the kitchen for another installment of The Cathy Brown Show, and wildlife expert Steve Backshall may have cause to regret joining Dermot and Buster's Celebrity Safari. Plus, another Thought for the Day from Father Damien and Father Trevor, and Pixie Lott closes the show, performing her new song Baby.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: New series. Just a month following the end of his last run, the diminutive Irishman returns with a brand now run of 13 shows. Here, Graham catches up with Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman, stars of new heist comedy Going in Style. Plus, comedian Jack Whitehall and Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan talk about their roles in BBC One's Evelyn Waugh adaptation, Decline and Fall. The nation's favourite man band Take That feature, while Graham also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle, Kate Humble and Jean Johansson go behind the scenes at Longleat House and Safari Park, and follow 14 lions who are tested for a potentially fatal disease.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties up for auction in Farningham, Kent, Great Barr in Birmingham and Crewe in Cheshire, then discuss the owners' plans.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence makes a suspicious discovery during the eviction of a group of squatters, while Tommy and Craig go looking for a steel company boss who owes money.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Reports on high street chains that have been selling real animal fur in the belief it is artificial, and dangerous children's nightlights. Matt Allwright presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Part two of two. David is pushed to find something to do for a training day, while Sid tries to help Karl, but ends up contemplating his own anxieties.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Single player Kate bids to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is property-hunting in Shropshire with a couple of keen gardeners who want their £425k to buy them a country home with ample space for them and their hot tub.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A pair of yellow deck chair frames, a wooden vice and a sideboard are the items rescued in Surrey and transformed by Sarah Moore and her team.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Charlie Ross evaluate the public's antiques at the Fleet Air Arm Museum, situated on the Navy's largest aviation base, HMS Heron in Somerset. A surprise discovery by the venue's director pushes the value up on one item, while presenter Paul Martin meets curator Dave Morris, whose pioneering way of working is bringing the exhibits to life in a way never previously imagined.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Shakil helps Bex with a spot of busking, only for Martin to force her back to work. But worse is yet to come with the arrival of Madison and Alexandra. Michelle also starts the day on a positive note, only for things to fall apart and she ends up drowning her sorrows in the Vic, while Kush's happiness at being with Denise proves short-lived when he spots Carmel and Max together.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Dominic and Isaac's toxic relationship finally reaches breaking point - but will Dominic find the strength to leave? With his fortunes finally on the up, Fletch's world is shattered by a life-changing revelation, and Matteo takes on the seemingly impossible task of reuniting Jac and Jasmine.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: After moving in with her sister, Kayleigh is now travelling to work on her own, but will she manage to resist temptation or call her old car share friend, John? Return of the sitcom about two supermarket employees, starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: New series. The comedy of Victoria Wood is celebrated by collaborator, Julie Walters, who looks at the characters her friend created that spanned generations. Beloved clips include Chrissie, the long-distance swimmer, dinnerladies, Acorn Antiques, Waitress and 14 Again. There are also contributions from colleagues including Celia Imrie, Duncan Preston, Anne Reid, Maxine Peake, Thelma Barlow and Shobna Gulati.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Spy in the IRA - Panorama.
programme.desc: The story behind one of Britain's most important spies since the Second World War. Code-named Stakeknife, Freddie Scappaticci worked for the IRA for decades, in charge of rooting out and executing suspected informers - but he was also spying for the British security services. Scappaticci denies the allegations, but is now the subject of a £35million criminal inquiry. Reporter John Ware investigates how Stakeknife operated, why his crimes were ignored and why he has been protected for so long.(n)

programme.title: No Strings Attached
programme.desc: Two childhood friends run into each other and end up sleeping together. Neither of them is interested in committing to a relationship, so they agree to keep things purely sexual. But despite their best efforts, they start to fall in love. Romantic comedy, starring Natalie Portman, Ashton Kutcher, Kevin Kline and Cary Elwes.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team gives advice on items connected to the British Empire, and presenter Paul Martin visits HMS Victory in Portsmouth.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Tommy and Craig attempt to recover more than £10,000 owed to a couple who bought a boat that turned out to be a wreck. Lawrence and Kev encounter some seriously heavy goods.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A broken Ercol coffee table requires extreme expertise to redeem it, while artisan bag maker Neil Wragg has to use all of his creativity to rethink an old bicycle.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, which is home to a collection of treasures. Objects brought in to be valued include a ship's anchor that was found in a garden pond, a medal awarded to sailor for helping to recover Captain Scott's ship from the Antarctic in 1901, some 17th-century flat pack furniture, and a flimsy booklet that proved to be a profitable investment.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Conversations
programme.desc: Sean Curran talks to former Labour party leader Neil Kinnock about his life and political career. First shown on BBC Parliament on 23 July. Postponed from April 5.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Whitstable to the Isle of Wight.
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads for Dover, where she learns how to pilot a hovercraft and discovers the science behind its operation in an experiment involving kitchen scales and a hair dryer.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len takes Jasper Carrott back to Barry Island in south Wales, where the comedian reminisces about a childhood holiday he had there in 1958.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Sheridan Smith, who went from singing with her parents in the working men's clubs near their North Lincolnshire home to successful stage performances in Little Shop of Horrors and Legally Blonde - not to mention her countless TV appearances - embarks on a journey to find out where her family's musical talents come from. She is soon hot on the trail of her great-great-grandfather Benjamin Doubleday, a world-class banjo player and musical impresario - but she is surprised by his change in fortunes.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: An emergency Caesarean on a cow leads to a worrying case for farm vet Graham, and Ian performs a dangerous operation on a rescue dog with painful ears. At a small animal hospital in Fife, a local celebrity - the town peacock - puts the pressure on vet Adam. Narrated by Felicity Kendal. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Empire of the Desert Ants.
programme.desc: Documentary filmed in Arizona, following a honey ant queen's rise to dominance and the methods it uses to extend its influence and keep its subjects under control, including cannibalism, genocide, the ruthless elimination of rivals and the sacrifice of thousands. Narrated by Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Egg
programme.desc: David Attenborough returns to Madagascar to see how the island has changed in the 50 years since his first visit, and to search for more clues about one of his most treasured possessions, the egg of an elephant bird, an ostrich-like creature that weighed half a ton. Scientists perform tests to determine the age of the egg, as the naturalist discovers whether the bird's extinction can shed light on what is happening on the island today.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant set off for their last leg from Gwersyllt, near Wrexham. After meandering through the border counties of north Wales and England, the pair finish up at their final auction in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bent's Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as the competition reaches its climax, with Wolfson College, Cambridge, battling it out in the final against either Edinburgh or Balliol College, Oxford, for the right to lift the trophy designed by Manchester sculptor Adrian Moakes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real Scotland.
programme.desc: Paul Murton boards the Jacobite steam train to make one of the world's most famous railways journeys, with his route starting at the foot of Ben Nevis in Fort William and continuing along to Mallaig and onwards to the Isle of Skye. For centuries, outsiders had seldom visited the beautiful landscape of the west coast, but then the power of steam changed everything and within a century, a network of railways spread across the entire country, connecting the industrial cities of the south to the mountains and glens of the north.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Giraffe Manor in Kenya, a unique hotel where giraffe, staff and guests co-exist in a 1930s Scottish-style hunting lodge on the edge of Nairobi National Park. The pair travel to the remote but luxurious outpost of Sasaab Lodge, a six-acre plot set within 82,000 acres of land owned by Samburu tribespeople, who receive a fee for every guest that stays and make up 75 per cent of the staff.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Chris Addison, broadcaster Sara Cox, comedian Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies are invited by Stephen Fry to consider misconceptions. As usual, the host awards points for the answers he considers most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: New series. Series following 10 strangers at turning points in their lives who are brought together to take over an Italian farm in the foothills of Mount Amiata, adjusting to the challenges of communal living in another country. In the first episode, they face the difficult tasks of bringing in a harvest of Merlot grapes and keeping the local wild boar at bay.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: When a protest halts construction at the palace, King Louis refuses to let Philippe help and matters escalate, allowing plotters to pose a genuine threat to the young monarch's rule. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Reports on the UK's forests. Matt Baker helps out with an inventory of the New Forest's trees, and Ellie Harrison visits Inverness to take a look at industrial timber production and the impact of forestry on red squirrels. Sean Fletcher reports on the Scottish tradition of hutting, John Craven examines the revival of working with horses in forests, and Charlotte Smith discovers whether enough trees are being planted in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern head to north Wales to meet Katy and Wayne Williams family, whose love of designer brands is already filtering down to their eight-year-old daughter. But all this spending comes at a price, and their use of credit cards is spiralling out of control. How will the couple feel when some of their luxuries are taken away? There is also a report on what to look out for when it comes to sun protection, a team of synchronised swimmers try out waterproof mascara, and Birmingham hairdressers put a selection of hairdryers to the test.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.sub-title: Tools of the Trade - Part One.
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts offer more advice on making money from antiques and collectibles, with this edition focusing on rare and valuable tools. There is also a feature on a piece of fascinating social history.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence puts the squeeze on a finance company that has not paid its rent, while officers visit an airline that has failed to pay compensation to a passenger for delays.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore reclaims three items from a Walsall recycling centre, with woodworker Norman Wilkinson rejuvenating a sewing machine and audio tech Horse restoring a record player.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Puerto Rico - Island of Enchantment: Natural World.
programme.desc: After being colonised by humans, Puerto Rico's rich natural resources were rapidly exploited for agriculture, industry and urban development - leading to 95 per cent of all its rainforests being lost. This documentary follows a conservation team fighting to save the most endangered creatures from extinction after they have been pushed to the edge of existence by human encroachment. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the latest Super League games, including Wigan Warriors v Castleford Tigers at the DW Stadium and Hull FC v Salford Red Devils at the KCOM Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The Strictly judge takes TV presenter Dan Walker back to Aberdeen to reminisce about a memorable childhood holiday he enjoyed there in 1991.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Food writer Mary Berry is one of Britain's best-loved TV cooks, finding fame thanks to her judging role on The Great British Bake Off. A self-confessed go-getter, she wants to trace her family tree to know where she gets her energy and drive from. The journey begins in Bath, where Mary grew up, and takes her to Norwich, where both her grandparents lived. Along the way she uncovers ancestors including a bankrupt book-binder, a self-motivated corset-maker and a third who worked in a much more familiar profession.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Bailey narrates a documentary examining the lives of an eccentric cast of unconventional and unusual creatures that do things differently, turning this oddness to their advantage, such as the parrot that has forgotten how to fly, the bear that has turned vegetarian and a penguin that lives in the forest.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough: 60 Years in the Wild
programme.desc: David Attenborough reflects on his TV career, charting changes in the natural world and mankind's understanding of the planet as well as developments in wildlife film-making. In the first episode, he looks back on the animal encounters that have shaped his career - from the early black-and-white Zoo Quest days to a close encounter with a lion pride in the pitch dark. He also shares a few tricks of the trade, such as how to catch a Komodo dragon and the secret to maintaining continuity in the most difficult circumstances, and recalls the making of landmark series Life on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and James Braxton embark on a new road trip, beginning in Boston, Lincolnshire, before ending at their first auction in the Norfolk town of Fakenham.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Santa Fe, New Mexico, to the Grand Canyon.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. He then sets off from Albuquerque to pick up Arizona's Grand Canyon Railway as heads off to witness one of the greatest sights on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the second heat, and judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden want more miniatures - 36 uniform eclairs and 36 identical Mont Blancs. For their Showpiece the teams are tasked with a Gateau de Mariage. When the final points are tallied, one team will have to leave.(n)

programme.title: Obesity: How Prejudiced Is the NHS
programme.desc: Professor Rachel Batterham, head of the obesity services at University College Hospital, examines the medical cost of obesity that is threatening to bankrupt the NHS. She explores whether there is 'fat prejudice' against obese patients within parts of the service that is stopping them accessing a potentially cost effective surgery, even when recent scientific research supports it.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: New series. The 50th season gets under way from Maidstone in Kent with performances by Leicester's Kasabian, UK electro-duo Alison and Will, better known as Goldfrapp. The acclaimed pianist also welcomes the Los Angeles bass player Thundercat, West Coast-based Anderson .Paak & The Free Nationals, Austin, Texas rock band Spoon and Phoenix-born singer songwriter Courtney Marie Andrews.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Alone with the In-Laws
programme.desc: Chris and Stacey from Bristol are getting married in the summer, and while planning for the big day is one thing, making a success of the years that follow is another. To help out, the Rev Kate Bottley comes up with an idea - they will spend a few days living alone with their respective in-laws-to-be, to find out what they can learn about each other from the people who raised them. After four days, will the couple still feel the same about trying the knot?.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford investigates the story of the two brilliant but controversial Hunter brothers, who transformed both medicine and art in 18th-century Britain. Their belief that students could only learn anatomy by carrying out dissections created an unprecedented demand for dead bodies - as well as a market for the growing trade of body-snatching from graveyards.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: Empire of the Tsars: Romanov Russia with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley tells the story of the dynasty that ruled Russia for more than three centuries, including figures such as Peter the Great and Catherine the Great, the struggle against Napoleon in 1812, and the political murders of Nicholas II and his family in 1918. In the first edition, she investigates the beginning of the Romanovs' 300-year reign in Russia, and charts ruthless Tsar Peter the Great's rule, who acceded to the throne at the age of nine.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge explores how the public's view of ancient Egyptian queen Cleopatra has changed over the years, from Roman propaganda through to Shakespeare's portrayal, and in the golden age of Hollywood, where she became a doomed romantic heroine. The presenter seeks the views of academic experts and refers to archive BBC documentaries and drama to explore Cleopatra's personal life and role as a politician, charting how throughout history the leader's image has been subject to myths and cliches.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Everyday Miracles: The Genius of Sofas, Stockings and Scanners
programme.desc: Part one of two. Professor Mark Miodownik provides an insight into the design techniques that contributed to the invention and production of everyday objects often taken for granted. He begins by focusing on items found in the home, including razor blades, tights, plywood and foam rubber.(n)

programme.title: The Toilet - An Unspoken History
programme.desc: Welsh poet and presenter Ifor ap Glyn examines the social history and evolution of the toilet. He starts in Merida, Spain, with a look at some of the earliest surviving Roman examples, before journeying around the world to witness toilets ranging from the beautiful to the bizarre.(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights, Brilliant Minds: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Dr James Fox tells the stories of three cities whose artists, thinkers, writers and musicians set the world on a new course. This episode focuses on Vienna in 1908, which was the year Gustav Klimt painted his masterpiece The Kiss, Sigmund Freud revealed the Oedipus complex, Egon Schiele produced startling pictures of humanity stripped to the bare essentials and both music and architecture took a bold step in a radical new direction. However, it was also the year a struggling young artist named Adolf Hitler arrived in the city, thus putting Europe on the road to destruction.(n)

programme.title: Empire of the Tsars: Romanov Russia with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley tells the story of the dynasty that ruled Russia for more than three centuries, including figures such as Peter the Great and Catherine the Great, the struggle against Napoleon in 1812, and the political murders of Nicholas II and his family in 1918. In the first edition, she investigates the beginning of the Romanovs' 300-year reign in Russia, and charts ruthless Tsar Peter the Great's rule, who acceded to the throne at the age of nine.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford tells the story of how Dr Henry Gray and Dr Henry Carter produced academic textbook Gray's Anatomy - the world's most famous study of the human body. Based on dissections they performed themselves, the accuracy of its descriptions and the stark beauty of its illustrations made it an instant bestseller. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: After months trapped in a port in northern France, the winds finally change and Duke William leads his vast invasion fleet across the Channel. Catastrophically, King Harold is 300 miles away in the north, having defeated the Vikings. Harold rushes back south, gathers a new army, and heads to Hastings to take on this new invasion. The two armies will meet at Battle in Sussex on 14 October, 1066, and the outcome will change the shape of England and Europe forever. Dan Snow presents. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Should We Go To Mars
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong, who has a diverse background in astrophysics, aeronautics and medicine, offers a guide through the ethical, technical and scientific challenges of attempting to send astronauts to Mars. Costing billions of dollars, and the lives of those brave enough to attempt it, Kevin asks if the possible benefits are really worth the risk?.(n)

programme.title: The Beginning and End of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili unravels the cosmic mystery of science's creation story, recreating key experiments to tackle the greatest question in science, beginning with how the universe came into being.(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears Goes Walkabout
programme.desc: The survival expert sets out to cross Australia, tracing the journey of John McDouall Stuart, the first European to travel on foot from south to north through the country's deserts. Demonstrating the importance of travelling light, Ray needs to squeeze every drop of moisture out of his surroundings to make it to his destination.(n)

American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Sasha Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan investigates the murder of an unpopular soap star and must deduce which member of the cast and crew had the strongest motive to commit the crime. Starring Dick Van Dyke and Ian Ogilvy.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.sub-title: Gold Train: The Bullet - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of three. Doc returns to Dodge, but is unable to help when Matt gets shot in the spine. The lawman is taken away for surgery on a train also carrying a shipment of gold.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Anna Kosovo, a friend of Ben Cartwright's, fears for her life when her husband becomes a raging lunatic and barricades both of them inside their home, threatening to kill anyone who tries to get inside.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his crew investigate the gruesome case of a five-year-old abducted from the play area of an amusement park and murdered in a nearby toilet block. It is a harrowing case, and time is of the essence - especially as everyone at the leisure complex has been detained until they can be cleared. Drama, starring David Caruso and Kim Delaney.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A taxi driver recently released from prison is murdered just hours after sending an e-mail to an old alias that Callen used when he went undercover to investigate three marines who stole $5million. Resuming the persona, Callen goes in search of the gang, one of whom is killed in a drive-by shooting.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rollin avoids the guards following the failure of the original plan, while Vossek is moved to solitary confinement and Briggs comes up with another strategy.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Part one of three. An attack on an al-Qaeda terrorist results in the inadvertent deaths of three innocent civilians, prompting Mac and Harm to investigate.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The marine son of a colonel-turned-preacher is found dead in woodlands after changing his religious persuasion. As the case unfolds, it becomes apparent to the agents that he could have been the victim of a hate crime. Meanwhile, Gibbs' father visits for the holidays. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Stewart is selected to be part of a group of men known as LA's most eligible bachelors, but is horrified to discover the chosen few are being systematically killed - and after examining puncture marks on the victims' necks, Sloan has to explore some unorthodox theories.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: The lawman tries to eradicate drugs from the street. Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West. Chuck Norris stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Sam and the team spring into action when fellow agent Dom activates a distress signal. They track down his car, which is riddled with bullet holes, and Eric intercepts a signal from his phone, tracing it to a house that contains nothing but some used medical supplies and a dead body. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, Calleigh and Speedle investigate the murder of an exotic dancer at a party, but have trouble finding a motive. Meanwhile, fellow officers Eric and Megan are mystified by the death of a diver. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney and Rory Cochrane.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Prince Iben Kostas plans to use his wealth to start a war, so the IMF team try to infiltrate his casino in a bid to stop him in his tracks. Martin Landau stars.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 520. programme.desc: Episode 412. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 619. programme.desc: Episode 310. Other pitches include a celebrity ghostwriting business; an online funeral-planning venture; and a Web site that offers VIP access to nightlife activities around the U.S. Also: an update on a Season 2 customized-speakers venture(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 605. Also: an update on Mark Cuban's $2 million investment in the Los Angeles Haunted Hayride during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 521. Also: an invention that could revolutionize shoe shining; a Rochester man's idea for colorful modular laces; and an update on KaZAM balance bikes from Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 405. programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie take a disastrous journey to New Orleans, while Arthur tries to create a comic strip for Playboy, only to find his artistic talents leave something to be desired. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie and Doug yearn to play a golf foursome at the country club, and set about finding a date for Deacon to complete the group - even though it seems he's perfectly capable of managing his own love life. Starring Kevin James and Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray realises that the angrier Debra gets, the better their sex life becomes - so he decides to stir up conflict between her and Marie. American comedy, starring Patricia Heaton, Doris Roberts and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Members of the parent-teacher association complain about Debra's outfits, leaving Ray facing the delicate task of persuading her to dress more conservatively in future. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink reads a steamy novel written by an old acquaintance from Boston - and discovers his teenage affair with a piano teacher has found its way into the plot. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Eddie impregnates a neighbour's dog, so Frasier decides to have him neutered. However, the elusive mutt has no intention of accepting his fate and flees into the city. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: New series. A 21-year-old cat needs to have a huge mass removed from its ear, but any general anaesthetic at this age is a big risk, while Scott Miller is concerned about the liver of a Chihuahua suffering from diabetes.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The arrival of a life-sized suit of armour and matching horse amuses staff at the new Hatton Garden shop, while MD James takes a trip down a canal on a barge that a businessman is looking to secure a loan against. A sunseeker hopes to sell some precious family jewellery to help fund a move to Spain, and Lawrence is faced with a mysterious wooden chest thought to have belonged to the royal family.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples host dinner parties in Sheffield, with Ray and Chloe, Andrew and Claire, and Rob and Emma all competing for the cash prize of £1,000.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer organises a trip to the Super Bowl with a busload of friends and acquaintances - but unfortunately for all concerned, his tickets turn out to be forgeries. With the guest voices of Rupert Murdoch, Dolly Parton, John Madden and Dan Marino.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Warship
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the Royal Navy's HMS Ocean on a seven-month active deployment, policing some of the most volatile waters on the planet and co-ordinating the fight against Isis. In this first edition, HMS Ocean leaves Plymouth for the Mediterranean, where the Tailored Air Group of elite armed forces helicopter pilots have just three weeks to learn how to take off and land on a carrier, but engine problems and the approach of a huge storm mean the new recruits and the old hands must pull together to succeed.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.desc: Doug's parents come to stay while Carrie is on a business trip, but insist on treating him like a kid. Arthur designs a new type of screwdriver and manufactures thousands of them when a hardware store shows an interest. Comedy, starring Jerry Stiller.(n)

programme.desc: Rob Bell examines the history of the Central Line, which at 46 miles is the longest in the Tube's network and connects east with west - transporting 260 million passengers a year. Rob learns that Bank's platforms are curved to avoid the Bank of England's vaults, and investigates a disaster during the Second World War in which 173 people were killed at Bethnal Green station while trying to shelter from an air raid.(n)

A van with a surprising load is tracked using state-of-the-art technology in a game of cat and mouse, and a high-stakes hunt for a stolen van and mini-digger on the M1 nearly leads to carnage. Jamie Theakston presents.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary about people living on benefits. Lisa spent seven years in prison for smuggling cocaine, and has been unemployed and on benefits ever since. Meanwhile, Callen and the rest of the team work to prove their colleague's innocence. Crime drama, starring Daniela Ruah and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Three Bedrooms, One Corpse: Teagarden Mystery
programme.desc: When the former librarian turns her talents to the real estate business, a grim discovery at a vacant house plunges her into another murder mystery. Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Peter Benson and Bruce Dawson.(n)
